topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Installation Guide

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Installation Overivew

body.p: This document describes the process for installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: About the installation
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation installs HP Helion Lifecycle Management VM, creates a base HP Helion OpenStack cloud, configures network virtualization through HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN), and deploys a carrier grade cloud.
After installation, you can interact with the HP Helion OpenStack cloud using the Horizon graphical interface or using the CLIs of the respective services.

section.title: Installation options
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade has two baremetal installation options depending on your system configuration. It allows you to manage the KVM and VMware ESX hypervisors and provision virtual machines.
You can find more information on the hypervisor options in the Technical Overview.

The following table indicates the components required for each deployment type. If your deployment indicates Yes in a column, you must install that component. If a column is blank, you can disregard that component.
Deployment All Deployments HP DCN VMware ESX Ironic Baremetal
Denver Yes
Tahoe Yes Yes
Memphis Yes Yes Yes
Sacramento Yes Yes Yes Yes

p.b: KVM Topology using the denver template

section.p: If installing the denver template, you are installing the KVM region and HP Helion OpenStack AVS networking.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

p.b: KVM with DCN Topology using the tahoe template

section.p: If you are installing the tahoe template, you are installing the KVM region and HP DCN VRS networking.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install DCN, 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

p.b: KVM + ESX with DCN Topology using the memphis template

section.p: If you are installing the memphis template, you are installing the KVM region and VMware ESX storage. The networking uses HP DCN VRS.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install DCN, ESX, and 3PAR and/or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

p.b: KVM + ESX + Ironic with DCN Topology using the sacramento template

section.p: If you are installing the sacramento template, you are installing the KVM region, VMware ESX storage, and a baremetal region (controlled by OpenStack Ironic). The networking uses HP DCN VRS.
You will need to perform tasks to integrate ESX and DCN with HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install DCN, ESX, and 3PAR and/or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

section.title: Unbonded or Bonded NIC configuration
section.p: During the installation, specific steps might be different, based on whether you are installing into a single NIC or bonded NIC environment.

section.title: Installation process
section.p: Use the following process to install HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.

ol.li:
Review the Technical Overview for information on the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade environment.
Review the Cloud Topologies to decide appropriate topology for your use case.
Review the deployment architecture for different hypervisors
Review the network architecture for networking needs
Review the Support Matrix to make sure your environment meets the minimum requirements.
Perform any required or optional installation prerequisites.

Install the cloud topologies:
KVM Deployment
In this cloud topology, the standard OpenStack services like Keystone, Glance, Cinder, Swift are installed in the non-KVM region first. Then the KVM region is installed.
Install Helion Lifecycle Management and Installation Services.
Install the HPE Helion OpenStack cloud. These components will be installed into what is called the Non-KVM region.
Launch the Helion user interface.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region.
KVM with DCN Deployment
In this cloud topology, the DCN components are installed along with standard services in the non-KVM region first. Then the KVM region is installed.
Install Helion Lifecycle Management and Installation Services.
Install the HP Helion OpenStack cloud and install the HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) components into what is called the non-KVM region
Launch the Helion user interface.
Configure required DCN components.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region
KVM + ESX Deployment
In this cloud topology, the components required to support ESX hypervisor are installed along with standard services in the non-KVM region first. Then the KVM region is installed.
Install Helion Lifecycle Management and Installation Services.
Install HP Helion OpenStack cloud and install the HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) components. You will also install the VMware ESX compute proxy. These components will be installed into what is called the non-KVM region and connect to the ESX cluster with DCN networking.
Launch the Helion user interface.
Configure required DCN components.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region

section.title: First Step
section.p: Perform the prerequisite steps and one time setup on your KVM Host required to install HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.
